ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: STRENGTHSvariety of instructors take turn to teachWEAKNESSESChange the class room.It is dingy and looks like prison, no ventilation and suffocating. Change the class room to upstairs and bring the office and lab to downstairs. Students health should be a priority for they deserved to be paid their worth.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Very knowledgeable.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Well prepared. Brings experience to course.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: YES, I would recommend to a friend as occupational health medicine is a new venture and not many are willing to take a career in it.

An excellent class to take! Little outside class work, great class discussions, and taught at a level where anyone can understand the material. I learned a lot, and it will help me no matter what path I take next.
Excellent course, we had a small class size so had great interactions and were able to ask questions and discuss situations to improve understanding and knowledge.
